page.title: 09EDUCATIONAL PROVISION(Cont.)
page.content: {BAINES ENDOWED SCHOOL. } The school was founded by an Endowment from{James Baines in 1717}as a school for the children of the Marton area. It's original building was used until 1929 when the present school was built with an infant block being added in 1959.Today there are a{total of 180 {infants and 237 junior pupils on roll {and a teaching staff of 15.}On leaving the school at{11+}pupils transfer to a number of local{High Schools}including St.George's,Warbreck,Greenlands, {Highfield}and Knowle.A few pupils move to independent schools such as Arnold School,Elmsley,Queen Mary's or King Edward VII. The school gives generous support to one major charity each year and in the
